frontend_faq010A.message: A Google Chrome (√©s felt√©telezhet≈ëen m√°s kr√≥m alap√∫ b√∂ng√©sz≈ëk) m√°r legal√°bb 2014-ben volt ilyen probl√©m√°ja/hib√°ja. Talkie van n√©h√°ny megold√°s a hely√ºk√∂n, √©s az olvas√°si sz√∂veg r√∂videbb r√©szek√©nt t√∂rt√©n≈ë enged√©lyez√©s√©nek/letilt√°s√°nak opci√≥ja. Folytatni fogom a megold√°st, de am√≠g a Chromium csapata m≈±k√∂dik, tal√°n nem m≈±k√∂dik 100%. Ha ezt a probl√©m√°t tapasztalja, k√©rj√ºk, tudassa velem, mely b√∂ng√©sz≈ë √©s verzi√≥, az oper√°ci√≥s rendszer √©s a verzi√≥, valamint a haszn√°lt nyelv/hang.
frontend_faq010A.original: Google Chrome (and presumably other Chromium based browsers) have had this issue/bug since at least year 2014. Talkie has some workarounds in place, and an option to enable/disable reading text in shorter parts. I will continue to improve the workaround, but until the Chromium team works it might not work 100%. If you experience this issue, please let me know which browser and version, operating system and version, and language/voice you are using.

frontend_faq010Q.message: Mi√©rt nem Talkie le Talkie 20-30 sz√≥ vagy n√©h√°ny m√°sodperc ut√°n?
frontend_faq010Q.original: Why does Talkie stop reading after 20-30 words or a few seconds?

frontend_faq011A.message: K√©t ok van. El≈ësz√∂r is, ha az akt√≠v hang online, akkor le kell t√∂ltenie a besz√©df√°jlt, miel≈ëtt lej√°tszan√°. Ez azt jelenti, hogy hozz√°adott sz√ºnet van, amely az internetkapcsolat sebess√©g√©t≈ël f√ºgg. Tudod ellen≈ërizni, hogy melyik hangok vannak online a hanglist√°ban. A m√°sodik ok az, hogy a hossz√∫ sz√∂vegek hossz√∫ t√°v√∫ megker√ºl√©se a r√∂videbb r√©szeken, √°ltal√°ban mondatonk√©nt vagy egy z√°rad√©kig terjed. Ez minden sz√ºnethez tov√°bbi sz√ºnetet adhat. Enged√©lyezheti a hossz√∫ sz√∂vegek olvas√°s√°t az opci√≥k egyik r√©szek√©nt, ami a t√°mogatott rendszerekre vonatkoz√≥ sz√ºnetet fogja t√∂r√∂lni.
frontend_faq011A.original: There are two reasons. Firstly, if the active voice is online it needs to download the speech file before playing it. This means an added pause which is depending on your internet connection speed. You can check which voices are online in the list of voices. The second reason is that the workaround for speaking long texts chops up the text in shorter parts, usually per sentence or per clause. This can add an extra pause for each pause. You can enable reading long texts as one part in the options, which should remove the pause on supported systems.

Kider√ºl, hogy a Google Dokumentumok (valamint a Google Spreadsheet, a Google Drive √©s hasonl√≥k) nem egy weboldal, hanem egy speci√°lis "alkalmaz√°s a b√∂ng√©sz≈ëben", amelyet a Google hoz l√©tre. Talkie nem tudja el√©rni a kiv√°lasztott sz√∂veget, √©s nem ad hozz√° semmi helyi men√ºelemet. Tov√°bbi vizsg√°latot fogok Talkie ha valamilyen m√≥don hozz√° lehet adni a Google Dokumentumok t√°mogat√°s√°t a k√∂vetkez≈ëh√∂z: Talkie .

It turns out that Google Docs (as well as Google Spreadsheet, Google Drive, and similar) is not a website but a special "application in the browser" created by Google. Talkie cannot access the selected text, nor add context menu items. I will investigate further if there is some way to add Google Docs support to Talkie.

Szint√©n tartalmaz olyan inform√°ci√≥kat, amelyek bizonyos weboldalakra vonatkoznak, ahol a hib√°t l√°tja, lehet≈ëleg egy linkkel.

Az alapv√°ltozat, felhaszn√°l√≥i fel√ºlet haszn√°lata n√©lk√ºl, kider√ºlt, hogy trivi√°lis, hogy hozzon l√©tre. Hozz√°ad√°sa egy felhaszn√°l√≥i interf√©szt, vett egy kicsit hosszabb. Hozz√°t√©ve megfelel≈ë nyelvfelismer√©s egy csom√≥ t√∂bb k√≥dot. Legy≈ëz√©se hib√°kat a b√∂ng√©sz≈ë m√©g t√∂bb munka. A list√°t a fejleszt√©sek √©s funkci√≥k megy ‚Äî √©s n√©h√°ny ezer sornyi k√≥dot k√©s≈ëbb n√©zel a v√©geredm√©ny.
frontend_storyDescription.original: Talkie was developed a few days before the New Year 2016/2017, on a challenge from a friend. The challenge started with the question: while commuting to work, is it possible to listen to an article instead of reading it? Easy, I said, and set out to prove it ‚Äî or at least to make my browser speak out text using a silly computer voice. The basic version, without any user interface, turned out to be trivial to create. Adding a user interface, took a bit longer. Adding proper language detection a bunch more code. Overcoming bugs in the browser even more work. The list of improvements and features goes on ‚Äî and a few thousand lines of code later, you're looking at the end result.
